31 Russell Melendez

Position Attack

Height 6-1

Weight 210

Class Senior

Hometown Severna Park, MD

Highschool Archbishop Spalding

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

Of Note

- Ranked as the #69 freshman in the nation by Inside Lacrosse in 2021. 2023

- Honorable Mention USILA All-American and a First Team All-Big Ten selection.

- Ranked second on the team in goals (37), assists (16) and points (53) and led the team in shooting percentage (.398) among players who took 15 or more shots.

- Ended season with a 12-game goal-scoring streak.

- Picked up an assist in his Hopkins debut, a 12-7 win at #17 Jacksonville.

- Scored four goals to fuel a 13-12 win over third-ranked Georgetown.

- Added one goal in an 11-7 loss to 19th-ranked North Carolina before missing game at 12th-ranked Loyola.

- Returned to lineup and had two assists in a 12-8 win over Utah.

- Rang up one goal and two assists in a loss to #1 Virginia and sparked 11-9 win at Syracuse with a three-goal performance.

- Scored two goals and added one assist in a 12-9 win at Navy. Assisted on the game-opening goal and scored the final goal in the victory.

- Big Ten Offensive Player of the Week after a four-goal, three-assist effort in a 15-11 win at Michigan. Seven points were a then career high and four goals matched then career best.

- Rang up career-high six goals in a 12-11 double overtime loss at #8 Penn State. Scored four of his six in the first quarter.

- Posted fifth hat trick of the season with three goals in a 17-8 Homecoming win over #17 Ohio State.

- Made immediate mark in first career Hopkins-Maryland game with two goals and three assists in a 12-11 win over the #4 Terps. Scored game-winning goal on amazing individual effort from behind the goal.

- Scored twice in the Big Ten Semifinals against #7 Maryland.

- Posted JHU NCAA Tournament record with nine points (5g, 4a) in 22-8 win over Bryant in first round of the NCAA Tournament. All nine points came in a 15-0 Johns Hopkins run that turned a 3-2 deficit into a 17-3 lead.

- Scored twice in a 12-9 loss to eventual national champion Notre Dame in the NCAA Quarterfinals. At Marquette

- Played in 10 games with seven starts in two seasons.

- Totaled 12 goals and nine assists in his two seasons.

- Played in seven games with four starts as a freshman in 2021 and rang up seven goals and four assists.

- Started first three games of the 2022 season before missing the remainder of the season with an injury.

- Posted five goals and five assists in first three games of the '22 season.

- Had one goal and a Marquette record-tying five assists against Bellarmine in 2022 season opener. At Archbishop Spalding

- Member of lacrosse, soccer and volleyball teams.

- Four-year member and two-time captain of varsity lacrosse team.

- First team All-MIAA, All-Anne Arundel County and All-Metro selection in lacrosse.

- Led team in goals and assists as a junior and senior.

- Earned two varsity letters in soccer and volleyball. Personal

- Russell Melendez.

- Son of Christine and Israel Melendez.

- Youngest of four children with older siblings, Lexie, Tommy, and Emily.

- Mother, Christine, played lacrosse and field hockey at Loyola.

- Majoring in political science with a minor in business.
